  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Manager, Billing",
  "description": "9mobile is a Nigerian private limited liability company. EMTS acquired a Unified Access Service License from the Nigerian Communications Commission in 2007. The License enables EMTS provide Fixed Telephony (wired or wireless), Digital Mobile Services, International Gateway Services and National/Regional Long Distance Services in addition to spectrum assignments in the 900 and 1800 MHz bands.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Manager, Billing

Job Location: Lagos

Job Summary


	This role provides oversight and governance of the Convergent Billing System (CBS) support covering all environments; Production, Test and Disaster Recovery to ensure adequate maintenance, operation and improvement of the entire CBS components and related software stack to achieve the required quality of service and service levels.&nbsp;


Roles and&nbsp;Responsibilities
Strategic/Tactical:


	Participate and contribute to the development and maintenance of the IT Strategy and IT Operating model
	Define and enforce IT Convergent Billing System and Operations related processes and procedures
	Provide input on Convergent Billing Operations to other relevant IT processes and procedures
	Responsible for policy, processes and systems involved in inter-connect billing and roaming service from IT standpoint
	Provides advisory services to IT Senior Management Convergent Billing services, solutions and operations
	Support BSS/OSS architecture design and optimization
	Support project planning and execution within BSS/OSS domain
	Drive continual enhancements and improvements to the Convergent Billing System and processes for business benefits&nbsp;
	Guide IT to optimal value creation using trending, analysis and benchmarking capabilities
	Drive for the attainment of agreed service levels Convergent Billing Operations related KPIs
	Liaise with revenue management in ensuring business revenue is secure with appropriate interventions where there are business exposures
	Support Performance Management unit in contract management, vendor management &amp; Service Level Management related to Convergent Billing Operations services


&nbsp;Operational:


	Provide oversight function for the Convergent Billing System operations and support
	Manage the monitoring of CBS related application services for availability, performance in line with agreed Service Levels, overall health check of underlying system processes, capacity in line with licensing and business requirements, batch jobs monitoring/management.
	Manage trend analysis, root cause analysis, known error establishment, and creation of Change Requests, Incidents and Problem tracking and escalation, resolution and closure, user administration, License Management &amp; Administration and service reporting.
	Accountable and responsible for managing post-paid billing operation ensuring customers gets accurate bills timely on an ongoing basis
	Drive regular health check service to provides comprehensive CBS application status information to aid the identification of potential issues and bottlenecks and forestall any events that may affect the availability, performance, and security of the application
	Manage the analysis and diagnosis of the resource utilization trends and problems associated with the application processes and tuning the CBS application environment, collaborating with IT Performance &amp; Capacity Management functions to achieve and/or maintain the agreed Service Levels
	Ensure proper documentation of the CBS application operating environments and storage into the knowledge management system for purposes of knowledge sharing and business continuity
	Manage the inquiry and request handling service in fulfilling standard and ad-hoc service requests
	Work with relevant stakeholders to develop and periodically update a standard recovery procedure for operation to follow when a disaster occurs.
	Ensure the adequacy of the standby Disaster Recovery (DR) infrastructure of the Convergent Billing System to either maintain operation functions at an interim minimal survival level and/or re-establish full scale operations at a state of normal operation level if possible
	Support the periodic disaster recovery drills for services involving the CBS as planned and executed by the Business Continuity team
	Ensure all system and non-system processes required to guarantee a successful transfer of services between primary and DR sites are operational and working as planned
	Implement a system to validate the integrity of replication and all GDR processes/services between the primary and DR sites and provide weekly reports to IT Management


Requirements


	Strong customer-centricity is required.
	4 to 6 years of combined experience work experience in Convergent billing &amp; Postpaid billing operations with role no less than half of those in an IT/Telecoms environment is strongly required.
	At least 3 years of experience in a managerial role.
	Experience with IT financial management, resource planning, task prioritization, budget / cost control. &nbsp;Strong ability to process data and extract actionable insights
	Sound knowledge of internal business processes, IT sourcing, vendor management and the mobile telecommunications industry; possesses a broad-based operational perspective and provides solutions.
	Experience in working / negotiating through complex issues and providing alternative solutions.
	Good knowledge of IT Service Management in general and IT Operations specifically is required.
	Highly developed business communications skill (verbal and written), solid team player, change agent, strategic and creative, excellent relationship management skills and the ability to drive performance, consensus from all areas within the company.

Manager, Billing Job at 9mobile




        
    

        
        9mobile is a Nigerian private limited liability company. EMTS acquired a Unified Access Service License from the Nigerian Communications Commission in 2007. The License enables EMTS provide Fixed Telephony (wired or wireless), Digital Mobile Services, International Gateway Services and National/Regional Long Distance Services in addition to spectrum assignments in the 900 and 1800 MHz bands.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Manager, Billing

Job Location: Lagos

Job Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	This role provides oversight and governance of the Convergent Billing System (CBS) support covering all environments; Production, Test and Disaster Recovery to ensure adequate maintenance, operation and improvement of the entire CBS components and related software stack to achieve the required quality of service and service levels. 


Roles and Responsibilities
Strategic/Tactical:


	Participate and contribute to the development and maintenance of the IT Strategy and IT Operating model
	Define and enforce IT Convergent Billing System and Operations related processes and procedures
	Provide input on Convergent Billing Operations to other relevant IT processes and procedures
	Responsible for policy, processes and systems involved in inter-connect billing and roaming service from IT standpoint
	Provides advisory services to IT Senior Management Convergent Billing services, solutions and operations
	Support BSS/OSS architecture design and optimization
	Support project planning and execution within BSS/OSS domain
	Drive continual enhancements and improvements to the Convergent Billing System and processes for business benefits 
	Guide IT to optimal value creation using trending, analysis and benchmarking capabilities
	Drive for the attainment of agreed service levels Convergent Billing Operations related KPIs
	Liaise with revenue management in ensuring business revenue is secure with appropriate interventions where there are business exposures
	Support Performance Management unit in contract management, vendor management & Service Level Management related to Convergent Billing Operations services


 Operational:


	Provide oversight function for the Convergent Billing System operations and support
	Manage the monitoring of CBS related application services for availability, performance in line with agreed Service Levels, overall health check of underlying system processes, capacity in line with licensing and business requirements, batch jobs monitoring/management.
	Manage trend analysis, root cause analysis, known error establishment, and creation of Change Requests, Incidents and Problem tracking and escalation, resolution and closure, user administration, License Management & Administration and service reporting.
	Accountable and responsible for managing post-paid billing operation ensuring customers gets accurate bills timely on an ongoing basis
	Drive regular health check service to provides comprehensive CBS application status information to aid the identification of potential issues and bottlenecks and forestall any events that may affect the availability, performance, and security of the application
	Manage the analysis and diagnosis of the resource utilization trends and problems associated with the application processes and tuning the CBS application environment, collaborating with IT Performance & Capacity Management functions to achieve and/or maintain the agreed Service Levels
	Ensure proper documentation of the CBS application operating environments and storage into the knowledge management system for purposes of knowledge sharing and business continuity
	Manage the inquiry and request handling service in fulfilling standard and ad-hoc service requests
	Work with relevant stakeholders to develop and periodically update a standard recovery procedure for operation to follow when a disaster occurs.
	Ensure the adequacy of the standby Disaster Recovery (DR) infrastructure of the Convergent Billing System to either maintain operation functions at an interim minimal survival level and/or re-establish full scale operations at a state of normal operation level if possible
	Support the periodic disaster recovery drills for services involving the CBS as planned and executed by the Business Continuity team
	Ensure all system and non-system processes required to guarantee a successful transfer of services between primary and DR sites are operational and working as planned
	Implement a system to validate the integrity of replication and all GDR processes/services between the primary and DR sites and provide weekly reports to IT Management


Requirements


	Strong customer-centricity is required.
	4 to 6 years of combined experience work experience in Convergent billing & Postpaid billing operations with role no less than half of those in an IT/Telecoms environment is strongly required.
	At least 3 years of experience in a managerial role.
	Experience with IT financial management, resource planning, task prioritization, budget / cost control.  Strong ability to process data and extract actionable insights
	Sound knowledge of internal business processes, IT sourcing, vendor management and the mobile telecommunications industry; possesses a broad-based operational perspective and provides solutions.
	Experience in working / negotiating through complex issues and providing alternative solutions.
	Good knowledge of IT Service Management in general and IT Operations specifically is required.
	Highly developed business communications skill (verbal and written), solid team player, change agent, strategic and creative, excellent relationship management skills and the ability to drive performance, consensus from all areas within the company.

Job Position:&nbsp;Legal Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos

Job Summary


	We are seeking a diligent and astute&nbsp;Legal Officer&nbsp;to join our team.
	The successful candidate will act as the primary custodian of the company&rsquo;s legal affairs, ensuring that our manufacturing operations&mdash;from raw material sourcing to the distribution of finished polypropylene sacks&mdash;comply with all relevant local and international laws.
	You will play a pivotal role in mitigating risk, managing regulatory compliance (specifically regarding environmental and factory acts), and drafting commercial agreements.

Contract negotiation and management:


	Draft and negotiate all types of contracts ensuring that they are handled from assignment to execution with quick turn-around time and minimal errors.
	Maintain a contract management system and ensure timely renewals and&nbsp;compliance with contract terms.
	Identify potential risks in contractual arrangements and ensure that the company&rsquo;s&nbsp;interests are protected.


Dispute Resolution:


	Ensure that matters are managed or settled to a successful conclusion.
	Liaise with external counsel and witnesses and collate evidence as required.
	Support internal investigations and settlement negotiations as required.


Compliance:


	Ensure that all returns and filings on behalf of the company are made before the deadlines.
	Maintain a compliance register along with the appropriate statutory records.
	Ensure availability of statutory documents and ensure timely and accurate correspondence with&nbsp;regulators.


Project Management:


	Assist in project planning and resource allocation.
	Ensure deadlines are met and costs are not exceeded.
	Coordinate communication among stakeholders


Debt Recovery:


	Follow up on recovery actions on debtors.
	Liaise with debt recovery agents to ensure debt repayments or resolutions.


Advisory:


	Provide accurate and timely legal advice to management and departments.
	Ensure the company&rsquo;s activities and policies comply with all laws and regulations.
	Monitor and interpret changes in laws, regulations, and industry practices that may affect the company.


Corporate Governance:


	Support in the preparation of board meeting documentation.
	Ensure adherence to corporate governance standards.
	Assist in developing and implementing internal policies and compliance frameworks.


General/Miscellaneous:


	Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders for the achievement of the company&rsquo;s goals.
	Provide a report every week on assignments handled during the week.
	Execution of any other matters as assigned.


Requirements

	Bachelor of Laws (LL.B)
	Call to Bar certification (B.L) is mandatory.
	Member of the Nigerian Bar Association, etc.


Experience:


	Minimum of 3 - 5 years of post-call experience.
	Prior experience in the Manufacturing, FMCG, or Industrial sectors is highly preferred.
	Demonstrable experience dealing with environmental regulatory bodies is a strong asset.

	Drafting Prowess: Ability to draft clear, concise, and watertight commercial agreements.
	Regulatory Knowledge: Deep understanding of Environmental Protection laws and Factory/Labor laws.
	Negotiation: Strong negotiation skills, particularly regarding procurement and sales contracts.
	Attention to Detail: Ability to spot liabilities in fine print.
	Interpersonal Skills: Ability to communicate complex legal concepts to non-legal factory management and staff.

Job Location: Lagos

Job Summary

	The successful candidate will act as the primary custodian of the company’s legal affairs, ensuring that our manufacturing operations—from raw material sourcing to the distribution of finished polypropylene sacks—comply with all relevant local and international laws.
	You will play a pivotal role in mitigating risk, managing regulatory compliance (specifically regarding environmental and factory acts), and drafting commercial agreements.


Duties and Responsibilities
Contract negotiation and management:


	Draft and negotiate all types of contracts ensuring that they are handled from assignment to execution with quick turn-around time and minimal errors.
	Maintain a contract management system and ensure timely renewals and compliance with contract terms.
	Identify potential risks in contractual arrangements and ensure that the company’s interests are protected.


Dispute Resolution:


	Ensure that matters are managed or settled to a successful conclusion.
	Liaise with external counsel and witnesses and collate evidence as required.
	Support internal investigations and settlement negotiations as required.


Compliance:


	Ensure that all returns and filings on behalf of the company are made before the deadlines.
	Maintain a compliance register along with the appropriate statutory records.
	Ensure availability of statutory documents and ensure timely and accurate correspondence with regulators.


Project Management:


	Assist in project planning and resource allocation.
	Ensure deadlines are met and costs are not exceeded.
	Coordinate communication among stakeholders


Debt Recovery:


	Follow up on recovery actions on debtors.
	Liaise with debt recovery agents to ensure debt repayments or resolutions.


Advisory:


	Provide accurate and timely legal advice to management and departments.
	Ensure the company’s activities and policies comply with all laws and regulations.
	Monitor and interpret changes in laws, regulations, and industry practices that may affect the company.


Corporate Governance:


	Support in the preparation of board meeting documentation.
	Ensure adherence to corporate governance standards.
	Assist in developing and implementing internal policies and compliance frameworks.


General/Miscellaneous:


	Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders for the achievement of the company’s goals.
	Provide a report every week on assignments handled during the week.
	Execution of any other matters as assigned.


Requirements
Education & Certification:


	Bachelor of Laws (LL.B)
	Call to Bar certification (B.L) is mandatory.
	Member of the Nigerian Bar Association, etc.


Experience:


	Minimum of 3 - 5 years of post-call experience.
	Prior experience in the Manufacturing, FMCG, or Industrial sectors is highly preferred.
	Demonstrable experience dealing with environmental regulatory bodies is a strong asset.


Skills & Competencies:


	Drafting Prowess: Ability to draft clear, concise, and watertight commercial agreements.
	Regulatory Knowledge: Deep understanding of Environmental Protection laws and Factory/Labor laws.
	Negotiation: Strong negotiation skills, particularly regarding procurement and sales contracts.
	Attention to Detail: Ability to spot liabilities in fine print.

Real Estate Advisor Job at Alaro City Development FZC




        
    

        
        Alaro City Development FZC is an integrated, mixed-use city planned for over 2,000 hectares in the North West Quadrant of the Lekki Free Zone. Alaro City’s vision goes beyond alleviating what is a self-evident problem - that of stifling urban congestion and a dearth of quality housing and commercial property in Lagos and Africa as a whole.
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Rather, we aim to help create the infrastructure - the living and working spaces, communities, schools, and hospitals - that will help sustain and accelerate Nigeria’s economic growth, meet the aspirations of Africa’s burgeoning middle classes, and serve as a catalyst for further urban development. The people in our team are multi-skilled and experts in their respective fields. They possess a unique drive, underpinned by the desire to help improve Africa’s urban development.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Real Estate Advisor
Job Location: Lagos

Job Description


	The Real Estate Advisor – Residential will be responsible for driving sales of residential products, engaging with prospects and investors, and guiding clients through the purchase journey.
	The role involves active relationship management, sales presentations, and collaboration with internal teams to ensure a smooth customer experience from inquiry to closing.


Key Responsibilities


	Generate, qualify, and convert leads for Alaro City’s residential products (including Residential plots – low, medium and high-density plots, Universal One Apartments, Alaro Haven, and Didara Waters).
	Conduct client meetings, virtual tours, and property inspections.
	Develop and execute sales strategies to meet or exceed assigned targets.
	Maintain a strong pipeline of potential buyers and track all client interactions in the CRM.
	Provide prospective clients with accurate information on pricing, payment plans, ownership structure, and investment benefits.
	Liaise with marketing, legal, and finance teams to ensure timely documentation and seamless client onboarding.
	Represent Alaro City at roadshows, exhibitions, and promotional events locally and internationally.
	Monitor market trends, competitor activity, and customer feedback to support continuous improvement.
	Maintain up-to-date knowledge of Alaro City’s masterplan, infrastructure delivery, and development milestones.
	Uphold Rendeavour’s brand reputation through professional and ethical client engagement.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Marketing, Real Estate, or related field.
	Minimum of 3 - 5 years of experience in residential real estate sales, preferably with a premium or mixed-use development.
	Strong sales track record with demonstrated ability to meet and exceed targets.
	Excellent communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills.
	Familiarity with CRM tools and digital sales platforms.
	Client-focused approach with strong attention to detail and responsiveness.
	Ability to work independently and collaboratively within a multicultural team.
	Experience dealing with diaspora or international clients is an advantage.


Soft skills:


	Sales and negotiation expertise
	Market and product knowledge
	Relationship management
	Presentation and communication skills
	Proactivity and initiative
	Professional integrity and client empathy.


Personal characteristics:


	High energy.
	Result-oriented.
	Strong work ethic.
	Impeccable integrity
	Ability to work effectively under pressure.
